isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE - Reference Voltage

svcproc.title: Reference Voltage
svcproc.para: The ECM sends a 5 volt reference signal to sensors in the control system. The ECM determines pressure, speed, position, and other variables important to engine and vehicle functions by comparing the regulated 5 volts sent to the sensors with signals from the sensors sent back to the ECM.
The ECM sends a voltage reference signal to three separate circuits.

item.para: V REFB for the cab sensors
V REFC for the body builder sensors
V REFD for the engine sensors

svcproc.para: Individual V REF circuits divides the electronic system to prevent a total V REF circuit failure. A current limiting resistor protects the ECM microprocessor from an external short to ground of a V REF circuit.
